intro: Schoenus tricostularia, commonly known as the three-costled sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, rushes, and grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, preferring moist to waterlogged soils. Schoenus tricostularia is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
